Name: Output Assertion Validator
Purpose: Validates assistant output against structural and semantic rules before it logs or mutates memory.
Output: pass/fail flag, error report if failed

Name: Preflight Commit Checker
Purpose: Runs instruction diff, schema check, and changelog verification before assistant logic is committed.

Name: Auto-Changelog Generator
Purpose: Auto-generates changelog entries based on diff between instruction versions.

Name: Instruction Drift Sentinel
Purpose: Watches output for behavioral changes and flags if drift is detected against previous output baseline.

Name: Tool Invocation Logger
Purpose: Logs every external tool call (function, plugin, API) for auditing and traceability.
Trigger: Every time a tool is used

Name: Memory Access Auditor
Purpose: Tracks what memory keys are accessed, when, and by which assistant for traceability and debugging.

Name: Permission-Safe Memory Injector
Purpose: Prevents unauthorized memory keys from being injected by verifying assistant roles against access rules.

Name: Response Schema Validator
Purpose: Checks whether assistant outputs match a predefined JSON schema before use.

Name: Token Budget Enforcer
Purpose: Enforces max token usage on output and prevents overlength responses.

Name: Redaction Filter
Purpose: Removes or redacts sensitive fields (PII, email, salary) before logging or memory write.

Name: Instruction Execution Replay
Purpose: Replays a full instruction + input + memory state for audit/debug.

Name: Run Consistency Comparator
Purpose: Compares outputs from multiple runs with same input to detect inconsistency or drift.

Name: Assistant Run Profiler
Purpose: Logs execution time, tool use, and memory call patterns for each run.

Name: Token Heatmap Generator
Purpose: Breaks down token distribution across prompt, memory, tools, and output.

Name: Version Drift Visualizer
Purpose: Visualizes how instruction sets have changed across versions.

Name: Log Summarizer
Purpose: Summarizes assistant logs by week, frequency, drift issues, tool use, and top inputs.

Name: Anomaly Detector
Purpose: Detects unexpected patterns, hallucinations, or dangerous output in assistant responses.

Name: Instruction Usage Tracker
Purpose: Tracks which instruction versions are used most frequently across assistant runs.

Name: Prompt Diff Tracker
Purpose: Logs and compares differences between compiled prompts over time.

Name: Assistant Failure Log
Purpose: Captures failure conditions, tool errors, or retries across assistant chains.

Name: Memory Key Frequency Analyzer
Purpose: Counts how often specific memory keys are referenced during assistant runs.

Name: Instruction Usage Heatmap
Purpose: Visualizes usage density of different instructions across time, roles, or projects.

Name: Output Tone Profiler
Purpose: Analyzes assistant tone, formality, and emotional weight per response.

Name: Top Prompt Tracker
Purpose: Ranks the most frequently used prompt templates and input formats.

Name: Response Length Monitor
Purpose: Tracks token count of assistant responses to detect bloat or truncation.

Name: Instruction Reference Mapper
Purpose: Traces which instruction lines are most commonly triggered or referenced.

Name: Log Data Compressor
Purpose: Compresses and archives logs older than a threshold to maintain performance and storage efficiency.

Name: Embedding Generator
Purpose: Generates text embeddings from memory, logs, or documents for vector DB indexing.

Name: Vector DB Uploader
Purpose: Uploads generated embeddings into a vector database like Pinecone or Chroma.

Name: Context Retriever
Purpose: Retrieves semantically relevant memory from vector DB based on current input.

Name: Semantic Lookup Validator
Purpose: Validates that retrieved context is relevant and not noisy or irrelevant.

Name: RAG Injection Filter
Purpose: Filters and formats retrieved context before prompt insertion to ensure compatibility and clarity.

Name: Chunker + Embedder
Purpose: Splits large files into chunks and embeds them for vector storage.

Name: Vector Query Router
Purpose: Decides which vector DB to query based on assistant role, project, or query type.

Name: Embedding Drift Analyzer
Purpose: Detects when embeddings diverge due to instruction changes or model updates.

Name: Vector Snapshot Archiver
Purpose: Creates snapshots of vector indexes to support rollback, export, or audit.

Name: Context Injection Comparator
Purpose: Compares final assistant behavior with vs. without context injection to measure RAG effectiveness.

Name: Function Call Router
Purpose: Routes incoming queries to the correct function or tool based on role, intent, or input type.

Name: Tool Call Fallback Handler
Purpose: Handles failed tool calls by retrying, using alternates, or providing a fallback message.

Name: Multi-Agent Task Dispatcher
Purpose: Distributes subtasks across multiple assistants and aggregates the results.

Name: Tool Result Verifier
Purpose: Validates whether a tool response meets structural and semantic criteria.

Name: Tool Usage Rate Limiter
Purpose: Prevents overuse of a specific tool by enforcing call thresholds.

Name: Parallel Tool Executor
Purpose: Runs multiple tools in parallel and combines their outputs for a unified response.

Name: Role-Based Tool Access Gate
Purpose: Restricts tool usage based on the assistantâ€™s assigned role and access rules.

Name: Multi-Agent Memory Sync
Purpose: Syncs shared memory updates across multiple assistants working on a common project.

Name: Agent Load Balancer
Purpose: Distributes execution load across a pool of assistants based on usage, availability, or specialization.

Name: Tool Call Explainer
Purpose: Generates a natural language explanation of which tools were used and why.

Name: Self-Reflection Engine
Purpose: Prompts an assistant to critique and improve its last output before finalizing response.

Name: Self-Correction Trigger
Purpose: Automatically retries or adjusts output if common quality issues or validation failures are detected.
Trigger: On failed assertion or drift score > threshold

Name: Multi-Run Consensus Agent
Purpose: Runs multiple versions of the same assistant and selects or merges the best result.

Name: Role-Chain Planner
Purpose: Plans a sequence of assistant roles for multi-stage reasoning and coordination.

Name: Autonomy Flag Evaluator
Purpose: Determines whether an assistant should continue autonomously or wait for user approval.

Name: Agent Interrupt Handler
Purpose: Gracefully stops or defers agent execution if flagged mid-run.

Name: Self-Confidence Reporter
Purpose: Estimates confidence score for assistant responses based on structural and semantic factors.

Name: Agent Delegator
Purpose: Delegates subtasks to other assistants based on a task-to-role matching map.
Trigger: On task fork or role mismatch

Name: Multi-Agent Loop Controller
Purpose: Controls feedback loops across assistants to improve output quality or correctness.

Name: Self-Evaluation Summary Generator
Purpose: Creates a report of how the assistant judged its own performance across runs.

Name: Role-Based Instruction Loader
Purpose: Loads only the instructions assigned to the assistant's current role.

Name: Assistant Scope Limiter
Purpose: Blocks assistants from accessing data or tools outside their authorized project or domain.

Name: PII Detector
Purpose: Scans assistant output for sensitive data like emails, SSNs, or payment info.

Name: Output Guardrail Enforcer
Purpose: Ensures outputs never violate defined rules (e.g., length, tone, banned terms).

Name: Instruction Mutation Watcher
Purpose: Detects unauthorized edits to instruction sets and logs modification metadata.

Name: Sensitive Keyword Blocker
Purpose: Redacts or blocks assistant responses containing blacklisted phrases.
Trigger: Before output is shown or logged

Name: Access Log Auditor
Purpose: Audits every assistant's file, memory, and tool access with timestamps.

Name: Secure Instruction Diff Validator
Purpose: Checks that instruction changes are authorized and matched to changelogs.

Name: API Access Control Filter
Purpose: Grants or denies access to external APIs based on assistant role and use-case.

Name: Role Boundary Enforcer
Purpose: Prevents role contamination by enforcing scoped logic boundaries.
